snippet: Some analysts say Mario Draghi, the European Central Bank’s president, might have a difficult time convincing investors that the bank will take decisive action against the euro debt crisis.
abstract: Some analysts say European Central Bank president Mario Draghi might have a difficult time convincing investors at the Sept 6 meeting that the bank will take decisive action against the euro debt crisis; say the bank probably needs more time to resolve internal differences and deliver on a promise to use its clout to tame runaway borrowing costs for the most troubled countries.

byline.contributor: Liz Alderman contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Some analysts say Mario Draghi, the European Central Bank’s president, might have a difficult time convincing investors that the bank will take decisive action against the euro debt crisis.

headline.seo: In Pivotal Week for Euro Debt Crisis, a Test for Mario Draghi
headline.main: In Pivotal Week for Euro Zone, a Test for the Central Bank’s Leader
headline.print_headline: In Pivotal Week for Euro Zone, a Test for the Central Bank’s Leader
